content:
Set Up Unified Knowledge

Before you set up Unified Knowledge, plan your implementation and consider its requirements and limitations. Also, set up Lightning Knowledge and any required data categories first.

To view the Data Categories page: View Data Categories in Setup
To create, edit, or delete data categories: Manage Data Categories

From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Unified Knowledge, and then select Unified Knowledge.
Accept the Terms and Conditions to continue, and choose the region in which to store your knowledge data with our trusted partner, Zoomin.

On the Unified Knowledge page, click Add a source.
Choose the connector that matches your third-party knowledge source, and click Next.
Type a Label for the connection, such as Confluence Articles. Type a Developer Name without spaces.
Enter the connector-specific fields that appear, which vary depending on the source.

If available on your connector, click Test Connector to verify that you correctly entered your third-party sourceâ€™s credentials.

From Open Article Behavior, choose whether article links open for users in Salesforce or the third-party source.

In Content, enter the connector-specific information needed to import content from the third-party source.
From Knowledge Field, choose the rich text field in Salesforce where imported article content is populated.
From the Record Type, choose the record type to apply to imported article content from your third-party source.
In Field and Data Category Mapping, map an external label from your third-party source to a corresponding Salesforce data category or Knowledge field.

In Multilingual Support, click On to select languages to support from your third-party source.
From Audience, click the Experience Cloud where users can see the knowledge content you import and sync from the third-party source.

Click Save.

After setting up a connector for a third-party knowledge source, an article import job begins. The job enters a queue and can take several hours or overnight to complete; timing depends on the number of articles to import and the number of jobs in the queue.
title: Setting Up Salesforce Unified Knowledge
